name: Anker Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This budget hotel is in quite a good location, not too far away from the cathedral/city centre by foot. 15-20 minutes from the central station. Oslo is a very expensive city and the Anker is one of the cheaper hotel options, especially if there are deals to be found on agents' websites. The rooms are quite small, but functional - fine for 1 or 2 nights. Small bathrooms, but again, fine if you're on a budget. We weren't particularly impressed with the service from the staff which was indifferent, surly and not particularly helpful. Neither were we impressed with the buffet breakfast, which although plentiful, was not very extensive or of high quality.
reviews.title: Very acceptable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for just one night getting a cheaper price through one of the online agents than the hotel's own website. As people say, small room, small bathroom but adequate for an overnight stay. Plenty of breakfast but quantity was its only real virtue. Bar service appalling - receptionists deal with requests when they can be bothered and with total lack of politeness.
reviews.title: Acceptable for one night

likes.disliked: — Dreadful bar service from rude receptionist.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007
reviews.text: we paid 1400 nok for a room for 2. the location is not bad. the area is a 10 mn walk from the main street (karljohan street) but just near a good neigborhood for restaurant at night with lively terraces. the area is cosmopolite.there is a huge youth hostel just near. the room was very small. the hotel is big and seems to be from the 70's. everything seems old. it is very noisy. it's definitly not worth this price.it would be more a 900nok /night hotel.
reviews.title: bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: if you have a better choice, keep looking. everything else was booked when we reserved
reviews.title: You can do better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: We were glad to only spend one night in the Hotel Anker. Not a bad location, but a good walk from Karl Johans Gate and the Central Station. The room was small and the bathroom smaller. It looks like they just converted an old hostel into a hotel. Keep looking.
reviews.title: Impressive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in December 06. Room was nicely decorated and clean, and as we were on the top floor we had a good view. Hotel is short walk into centre, with good transport (tram just opposite).
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My budget conscious choice worked out really well. This hotel is about as cheap as you will get in Oslo. I stayed here twice in the space of a week en route to and from Bergen. Rooms were good on both occasions, clean and had a good view. Bathrooms were a bit small and stuffy but relatively clean. Breakfast was good also but could have had more hot options. Staff were helpful (but perhaps a little distant).
reviews.title: Great location close to Grunerlokka

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once we got a map of Oslo from the hotel no need to take expensive taxis again. Right outside are buses and trams to take you to station, centre, Grunerlokka and beyond. A visit to Grunerlokka was one of the highlights of my trip to Oslo, within 5 mins walking distance there are really good cafes, boutiques and bars with a distinctively hippy laid back appeal. Beer is much cheaper up here also, 2 pints of Ringes beer and a glass of peanuts in Cafe Kaos cost NOK960 - this is good!!! You can sit outside many cafes in the square and Cafe Paradiso and Munch Cafe are very nice places to do this.
reviews.title: Good Hotel.

likes.liked: — The easy accessibility of the city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Bottom line - hotel clean and great location
reviews.title: Really good breakfasts

likes.disliked: — Had to pay for every non-norwegian TV channel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have read some others' comments about the Anker and I feel that they might be a little too harsh!
reviews.title: nice basic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We began a three week tour of Europe with three nights at the Anker. As many other reviewers have said this hotel is a great deal in a very expensive city. It is a short walk to the main center of town, but if you cross the bridge, there is also a quieter more residential area with restaurants that is nice.
reviews.title: A great deal and a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel has free internet, a good breakfast, and a very clean presentation. Those looking for luxury will be disappointed, though they should not be expecting it based on the price and the hotels own website.
reviews.title: OK for 1 night although overprices; proximity and service are good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This 3*-hotel is situated either 15 easy walking minutes or 5 driving mins. (Taxi: ca. NOK 101.- = EUR 12.-, credit card payments very common in Norway if you prefer not to exchange EUR for your 24hrs stay in Oslo) from the main train station, which is again 20mins. away by airport train shuttle for approx. EUR 22.- In the proximity of the hotel there’s lot to drink&eats and you’ll walk only 15mins. to the main shopping street that leads to the Royal Palace. Now in June it’s still kind of bright until midnight, very exciting!
reviews.title: Just great!

likes.liked: — Great value, nice comfortable location, walkeable from train station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Helpful receptionist, my large room on the 10th floor reminded my of a YMCA: 3 single beds, kitchenette with sofa, TV with 10 channels, toilet only separated by curtain from the shower head, tiny bathroom. There’s sort of a wardrobe and anteroom. The noice from some juveniles was heard on the 10th floor with opened window. WIFI for charge didn’t work but there’s a internet-PC at no charge in the hotel lobby, just next to the breakfast room.
reviews.title: Good value for money in an expensive city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Acceptable stay for just a night, slightly overpriced, but hey, we are in Oslo!
reviews.title: Checking out early - not good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived not expecting too much as we paid a fair price because Oslo is an expensive city. The hotel is 10 min walk from central station with plenty of trams and buses which service the area. The room is clean and the decor is modern. The only bad point is that when you shower, the entire floor gets wet. However because the bathroom floor is heated, everything dried very quickly. There are lots of storage space and a bit of a balcony where you can step out. We had a room overlooking the church and the ski jump which was nice to wake up to. The staff is courteous and informative. The breakfast is plenty (hot and cold) and varies slightly daily. You may want to load up during breakfast as it is expensive to eat in the city.
reviews.title: Convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Best Western Anker hotel for two nights at the end of December 2006. It was very good value - cheap, great free breakfast, convenient location, and very friendly and helpful staff. The area was fine, the room was good and very comfortable, and we had no complaints at all. I would happily stay there again.
reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful is just about right

likes.liked: — Great value, very comfortable bed, fantastic free buffet breakfast, lovely staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was a bit unsure before I booked this hotel having read some of the reviews which are none too flattering however, I could not have been more wrong!
reviews.title: Cheap, Cheerful, does exactly what it says on the tin!

likes.disliked: — Nothing- you get what you pay for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Firstly, this is potentially one of the cheapest hotels in a very expensive country so be careful that you dont expect total luxury.
reviews.title: Average and clean hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: It is an easy 10 mins walk from the centre of town, I dont know which way other people walked who claim it to be further but in a timed dawdle from the busterminal, it took us 8 minutes with bags!
reviews.title: Quite a hike to the Anker

description: Anker Hotel is a popular and affordable 3 star hotel in Oslo city centre. Walking distance to the central station and to all major attractions. Parking facilities. Buses and trams nearby.
